intro: Lychnis dioica, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. Lychnis dioica thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as dunes and rocky areas.
